page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Employment is at a remarkably high level in this area. This may be because of a general affluence and the population make up of the area. There are many retired people and a goodly number of farmers and self employed persons. A large number of the remaining male population is of the "middle executive" type mainly commuting to their jobs in Pershore, Worcester or Birmingham. There is also a number of people employed in Local Government. Most of the school leavers either progress to further education or move to the larger towns or cities for their further employment. The only residents apparently desiring more employment are married women with families who are always interested in part time jobs. Many enquiries for the job of school secretary here were received.
